Past Session Information: Behavioral technique was introduced in the last session where she it was decided to postpone her urge to smoke for 10 minutes every time she felt like it.
History: Present history: Patient has been smoking marijuana and finds it difficult as well as unnecessary to quit smoking. She would smoke for more than 20 marijuanas. She started working and was suggested by her uncle to quit smoking and come out clean for 2 months. According to the patient, her parents have no objection with this habit and she herself wishes to continue it but is only trying to quit as she wishes to hold a job.
Current Mental Status Examination: General behavior: Rapport was established and patient was cooperative. She was receptive of therapy and took an active participation; Judgement: Personal judgement impaired.
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient was able to resist her urge of smoking by postponing it to 10 minutes and was also able extend it for an hour by indulging in different social activities that came her way.
Reflections by the therapist: Patient has been adhering to the treatment but she was less motivated for it. She has been doing it for her job. It was suggested to increase the delay for 20 minutes from 10 minutes. She was reluctant to it and the mutually decided time was 15minutes during which she can use distraction like going for a walk or binge watch TV.
